content.description: Climb through a few awkward side-pulls to easier terrain.  The route trends left through the bottom and then straight up on easier holds.  The bottom should clean up with traffic, but there isn't much of that at New Canyon.
content.location: Farthest left side of the Mighty Wall.

content.description: It's on the far left of mighty wall 5 bolts with a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: Just to the right of windy excuse and the left of DNA

content.description: 4 closely spaced bolts with easy climbing until the final moves.
content.location: No longer the farthest route to the right on Mighty Wall. To get there, find the large break in the wall (chimney), where the wall begins to get noticeably shorter. Primal Virtue is on the left side of the break and follows the arete. There are now two routes to the right of this one. One right next to it to the right on the short pyramid, and one about 50' right.

content.description: Monkey time is a 4 bolt 2 bolt anchor.  In between primal virtue ( to the left ) and monkey clip ( to the right)
content.protection: 4 bolts, may or may not be a 2-bolt anchor
content.location: On mighty wall second climb to the left
Right before the access trail to the top of the formation on the far right side of Mighty Wall.

content.description: Start to the left and work your way right after the second bolt. Great place to learn how to lead with very closely spaced bolts. Consistent climbing with no obvious crux.
content.location: 2nd route from the right on the Mighty wall

content.description: The climbing at Mighty Wall is moderate to very easy (with the exception of Spank That Monkey), and has several great sport leads for first timers.
